document_data.name: T'an-zao
document_data.mainbody: '''T'an-zao the Gajin''' was a bandit leader in [[Kozakura]] in [[1357 DR]].
document_data.Activities: T'an-zao led a bandit gang with around 400 members, of all kinds of origin, with a group of lieutenants and a mainland [[wu jen]] in his service. They were based in a secluded valley.
document_data.History: T'an-zao was an explorer from the [[Plain of Horses]] who, in [[1347 DR]], was shipwrecked in Kozakura with his entourage and started life as a bandit. Many times, [[Niwa Hirotada]] sent expeditions to eradicate T'an-zao's bandit group but he always retreated.
document_data.Personality: T'an-zao was a brilliant tactician, fusing tactics from his homeland with Kozakuran ones. He had a very capable cavalry. From his homeland, T'an-zao learned only death and plunder. He was clever but vindictive. However, T'an-zao recognized his weaknesses.
